name: Marshall
review:
I've purchased Revlon Ultra HD Matte Lipcolors in the past, and I've found them to be pretty hit or miss - the lighter, more neutral tones tend to be pretty good, but the darker tones I've tried have all left me seriously wanting. So, when I received the Ultra HD Matte Metallic lipcolor in Gleam, I already expected that it would become a new favorite. This neutral, warm, pink tone is exactly the type of lip color I would pick up in store, and is exactly the kind that Revlon gets right. It's that perfect "my lips but better" shade, but with the added benefit of SO MUCH GLITTER AND SHINE.

The formula has a somewhat whipped consistency, like the rest of the Revlon Ultra HD Matte lip colors, and has that distinct, sweet, candy-like scent. I know some people who aren't a fan of that scent, but I've always liked it. The product applied smoothly, with no streakiness or patchiness. It is a fairly sheer color - I still think it looks really nice alone, but I could see myself using it as a "topper" for other lipsticks, to add a little dimension.

I have to say, I do not consider this product - or at least this shade - to be "metallic". It's very, very glittery and shiny, but that does not equal metallic. Is it pretty? Yes, very! Is it shiny? Yes, very! Am I going to recommend it to others? Yes, totally! But is it metallic? No. No it is not.

Now, for anyone who had never used a Revlon Ultra HD Matte Lipcolor before, ARE NOT completely transfer proof and DO NOT dry down completely. Although, I think that's why I like them so much - because of this, they aren't drying, like so many other matte lip products. And I can live with a little bit of transfer as long as it keeps my lips from feeling like the Sahara desert.

*This post was sponsored by Revlon as part of a sampling activation for Crowdtap. I received complimentary products to facilitate my review.*
